page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: There was once a smugglers route from Newhaven to Plumpton.There was once a cottage called Greencross. Once in Plumpton,near the station,there was a blacksmiths shop. Then it changed into a tuckshop.Since then the building has been made into a small hairdressers shop. The station is very old and opened in 1863.The people who looked after the station had to walk to Newhaven and back.The station is still open today but the gates are old and rusty and are made of rotten wood.Not many trains stop at Plumpton.They come from Brighton or Eastbourne and go to London.Plumpton Place was once surrounded by a moat but this was made into three lakes in the reign of King Henry The Eigth.
